Configure Workflow Args
nodes.notes:
This is useful to quickly setting variables for new workflow variants. Additionally:
- It helps avoid leaving important information in a node when creating new templates to share.
- Easier to add new variables.

nodes.notes: If you don't want to use the Global Variables Node, you can use this one as a replacement.

nodes.notes: It is a necessary node because sites like lobste.rs do not provide the actual content of the links.

nodes.name: Combine General Summary with Specific Summaries
If Not Empty
nodes.notes: It is necessary because the JSON parser can fail while still returning a success status for some reason.

nodes.name: Custom Feed Test
nodes.notes: This node is used to test new RSS Feeds before adding them.

nodes.name: Prep QA Results
nodes.notes:
This node will prepare the QA results for the next step.
Obs: we don't need pubDate after already using it for filtering, so I'm ignoring it in this step.

nodes.name: Configure Workflow Args (Custom Credentials)
nodes.notes:
This is useful to quickly setting variables for new workflow variants. Additionally:
- It helps avoid leaving important information in a node when creating new templates to share.
- Easier to add new variables.

nodes.name: Webhook: Call Workflow Activation
nodes.notes:
To execute a POST request using cURL, you can use the command: curl -X POST [URL] -d "key=value". This sends data to the specified URL in the request body.

For this node, you can use:
curl -X POST http://localhost:5678/webhook-test/deep-news-curator

nodes.name: Respond to Webhook: JSON with Result
Write contents to disk
nodes.notes:
- Hint -

Use:
sudo find / -name "filename"

If you cannot find the file in your Linux.
